title: Strengthening Systems Design Competencies: Open-Source 3D Game Engine Development for Emergency Response Training

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational programming knowledge (C# or Python) and understanding of game engines/3D modeling concepts
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can select and integrate one physics engine and one rendering system in an open-source 3D game engine (e.g., Unreal Engine, Godot) and develop a basic framework prototype running for 10+ minutes within three months
Implement an interactive virtual environment reflecting emergency response training scenarios (fire, earthquakes, etc.).

Learners can contribute to at least one GitHub open-source project (create 3+ issues or submit 2+ PRs) and document/submit five or more stages of the collaborative development process (code review, issue tracking, CI/CD pipeline)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
